text: Jaan van de Kuypers, the true Lord of the Marienburg Directorate and the Richest man Alive, seeks to consolidate his power within the halls of the Stadsraad and far beyond.

Jaan van de Kuypers is reputedly the richest man in the world, he became the head of the family when his elder brother, Bertold, went insane and slaughtered their parents and sister. The truth of this event is more sinister however, as Jaan made a sacrifice to Khorne, summoning a bloodthirster who he ordered to murder his parents. He blamed Bertold all so he could inheret the entire estate. Now, he counts among his personal friends the Tsar of Kislev, the King of Bretonnia, the Sultan of Araby and even Emperor Karl Franz and the Electors. All of them owe him money. He is the true leader of the Directorate: through his web of clients and contacts. The family has the broadest interests of any of the Ten, ranging from Averlander corn to medicinals from Cathay. Jaan van de Kuypers takes a personal interest in the Lustrian trade. The family mansion is in Goudberg, almost connected to the New Palace. Their symbol is a carmine shield divided into three parts: fist topmost, then a gold coin and a quill.

Shadows of the Wasteland

All I'm saying, and I do see the irony, is that the Directorate needs a counterbalance before we all become Jaan's footmen.\\n\\n— Karl den Euwe to Sasha van den Nijmenk shortly before his son Egmond departed for a trading mission to Cathay. \\n\\n Far in the East young Egmond sets out on a do-or-die attempt to save his families standing among the Marienburg Merchant Houses as the Den Euwe's approach bankruptcy. The road to catastrophy is paved with good intentions however, as Egmond succumbs to the teachings of Tsien-Tsin, a diety he thinks has the answers to save his family's name. Little does he know, Tsien-Tsin is none other than Tzeencth himself.

The Lord of Shadows, Mundvard the Cruel, rules the Wasteland's underground with a wrathful iron fist. He is known as the Scourge of Marienburg. Controlling large underground criminal syndicates responsible for the disappearance of many a unsuspecting Wastelander. Their fate unknown, as contrary other Vampire Lords, Mundvard sees in men more than cattle. He sees opportunity, be it via the slave trade or as thralls to serve his cause. The Lord of Shadows watches closely from his lair, waiting for the perfect moment to pounce and rule over the Wasteland.

The business of Marienburg is.. Business.\\n\\n - Jaan van de Kuypers\\n\\n A glass of sherry resting comfortably in his left hand, Jaan van de Kuypers leans back in his armchair. His affairs in order, his plan in motion. He is the richest man in the Old World and the most influential merchant of the Empire. His agenda noticeable in all Marienburger dealings. From his Goudberg Estate he plots his next move, attempting to quench his insatiable thirst for more wealth, more gold. More control.
On the Eastern shores of Cathay, Egmond den Euwe seeks to save his family from certain bankruptcy in a desperate quest for trade. Unfortunately, his desperation has caught the eye of Tzeentch.
The Lord of Shadows rules from the underground, plotting supreme reign over the Wasteland. Establishing his power via networks and syndicates.

Cult of Manann
Manann's Faithless
The Matriarch of the Sea has travelled to the far corner of the world on a mysterious quest to do Manann's bidding and fuflill the Cult's destiny.

Camilla Dauphine is the Arch Priestess of the Cult of Manann, nicknamed the Matriarch of the Seas. Like the Cult of Sigmar Mannan’s Cult actively seeks out to destroy those who oppose their Patron God. This plight has led Dauphine to the distant land of Khuresh, where she must hunt and destroy the avatar of Stromfel, the Red Chaos Whale. With limited supplies she must settle foreign ports to gain supplies from the Great City of Marienburg.
The Cult of Manann
Camille Dauphina, Matriach of the Sea
Sea Magicker||Battle Prayers of Manann

The Lore of the Sea is based around the manipulation and transformation of water. It is completely unrelated to the so-called Lore of the Deep, which has been rightfully banned as unholy magic of the evil Stromfel. Although not formally recognized as one of the major lores by Teclis, it is commonly taught at the Baron Henryk's academy in Marienburg.

House Fooger
House Fooger Rebels
Arkat Fooger, brought to the brink of bankruptcy by Jaan van de Kuypers travels to Ind in a desparate attempt to exploit new business opportunities.

Arkat Fooger is the oldest and shortest lords of the Marienburg Directorate. For almost a decade he and his House have controlled the Wastelandic iron and arms trade without little competition. Although dwarfish by blood, he is Marienburger by heart. His luck turned however when Jaan van de Kuypers set him up for a string of economical misfortunes. Desperate to save his seat among the directorate Fooger travels to the distant lands of Ind to exploit new business opportunities and save his name and fortune.
Corsairs of the Spire
